responses.content:
Here is the YAML object equivalent to the type LeadList, based on the provided Pydantic definitions:

```yaml
leads:
  - headline: SQL Injection vulnerability in login form
    analysis: |
      The login form on the site is vulnerable to SQL injection attacks. An attacker can inject malicious SQL code into the username or password fields, which can be used to extract sensitive data from the database or gain unauthorized access to the system.
    cwe: CWE-89
    function_names:
      - login
      - authenticate
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/com/example/app/controllers/AuthController.java
    classification: very promising
  - headline: Reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in search function
    analysis: |
      The search functionality on the site is vulnerable to reflected cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. An attacker can inject malicious JavaScript code into the search input, which will be reflected back to the user's browser and executed, potentially allowing the attacker to steal sensitive data or perform unauthorized actions on behalf of the user.
    cwe: CWE-79
    function_names:
      - search
      - handleSearchRequest
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/com/example/app/controllers/SearchController.java
    classification: very promising
  - headline: Insecure Direct Object Reference vulnerability in user profile page
    analysis: |
      The user profile page on the site is vulnerable to an Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) attack. An attacker can manipulate the URL to access the profile pages of other users, even if they are not authorized to do so, potentially exposing sensitive information or allowing unauthorized actions.
    cwe: CWE-639
    function_names:
      - viewProfile
      - getProfile
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/com/example/app/controllers/UserController.java
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: SQL Injection vulnerability in login form
leads.analysis: The login form on the site is vulnerable to SQL injection attacks. An attacker can inject malicious SQL code into the username or password fields, which can be used to extract sensitive data from the database or gain unauthorized access to the system.

leads.headline: Reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in search function
leads.analysis: The search functionality on the site is vulnerable to reflected cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. An attacker can inject malicious JavaScript code into the search input, which will be reflected back to the user's browser and executed, potentially allowing the attacker to steal sensitive data or perform unauthorized actions on behalf of the user.

leads.headline: Insecure Direct Object Reference vulnerability in user profile page
leads.analysis: The user profile page on the site is vulnerable to an Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) attack. An attacker can manipulate the URL to access the profile pages of other users, even if they are not authorized to do so, potentially exposing sensitive information or allowing unauthorized actions.
